result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessica K Mahlstedt

defendant.name: Mahlstedt, Jessica K

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Jury selection on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial on November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

3:04PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Jessica K Mahlstedt in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jessica K Mahlstedt.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson state def. is not prepared to proceed to plea/sentencing.  Requests it be set for trial.
questions by Court
Court gives State a last best offer date of Oct. 19, 2022

File with clerk a certificate of last best offer.
Def. has until 10/27/22 to accept the offer or go to trial

If no resolution by 10/27/22 then the trial is on. If settles after that, costs will be assessed to whomever acted after the 10/27/22 deadline.
Jury selection scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:45 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Jessica K Mahlstedt in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jessica K Mahlstedt.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court inquires as to the status of this matter
Atty. Erickson states an offer was received, requests continuance for two months, matter will be resolved.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on August 11, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
2:35 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jessica K Mahlstedt appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Jessica K Mahlstedt.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard and Information has been filed. 

Atty Erickson is heard and defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 

Court has reviewed the substitution of Judge.  Court approves.  Notice of hearing will be sent when a new judge is assigned to this case.

10:03 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Jessica K Mahlstedt appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Jessica K Mahlstedt.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

 All parties ready to proceed to Preliminary hearing.

1W- ANTHONY BERG -Sworn
exam. by Atty Steiner
cross exam. by Atty. Erickson

State moves for bind over
Atty. Erickson objects to bind over

Court finds probable cause to bind def. over for further proceedings

Atty. Erickson requests separate date for Arraignment
Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:20 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jessica K Mahlstedt in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Jessica K Mahlstedt.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:21 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Jessica Kay Mahlstedt appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court finds probable cause.

State is heard on bond. State requests a $150.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with the Walmart in Bridgeport. 

Defendant is heard.

Court orders a a $150.00 cash bond.  Defendant shall have no contact with the Walmart in Bridgeport. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
